sentences.en: Baroness Thatcher's claims seem credible to many.
sentences.cn: 撒切尔女男爵的主张在很多人看来是可信的。

sentences.en: Becky Thatcher had stopped coming to school.
sentences.cn: 贝基?撒切尔不来上学了.

sentences.en: Bob Tanner was there, and Johnny Miller, and Jeff Thatcher, when I said it.
sentences.cn: 当时,鲍勃-唐纳在场, 约翰尼-米勒 、 杰夫-撒切尔也在.

sentences.en: But I bet you Jeff Thatcher couldn't. "
sentences.cn: 但我敢打赌杰夫-撒切尔就不行. ”

sentences.en: If Margaret Thatcher wins, she will be more a Leader than a Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 如果玛格丽特-撒切尔获胜, 她将成为首领,而不是首相.

sentences.en: Judge Thatcher had conceived a great opinion of Tom.
sentences.cn: 萨契尔法官对汤姆非常器重.

sentences.en: Margaret Thatcher was their hero, their saviour, the one person they knew they could trust.
sentences.cn: 在他们眼里,玛格丽特·撒切尔是一位英雄, 是他们的救世主, 也是他们最能信赖的人.

sentences.en: Margaret Thatcher's espousal of monetarism eventually brought inflation down in the early 1980s.
sentences.cn: 玛格丽特·撒切尔对于货币主义的拥护最终使通货膨胀在20世纪八十年代降了下来。

sentences.en: Mrs Thatcher agreed to discuss these questions.
Mrs Thatcher fell in love, too. With the exact opposite.
sentences.cn: 撒切尔也堕入了爱河, 爱上了恰好相反的东西.

sentences.en: NARRATOR: Margaret Thatcher had a instinct for market economics.
sentences.cn: 旁白: 玛格丽特.撒切尔对市场经济有一种本能的直觉.

sentences.en: Nevertheless, Thatcher's sometimes hectoring, sometimes condescending manner irritated many voters.
sentences.cn: 尽管如此, 撒切尔的风格还是惹恼了许多选民.

sentences.en: Thatcher argues that to do so would risk the loss of 125 000 jobs in Britain.
sentences.cn: 撒切尔则认为这样做就会使英国12.5万人有失业的危险.

sentences.en: Tom Sawyer was in the skiff that bore Judge Thatcher.
sentences.cn: 汤姆-索亚和撒切尔法官同乘一条小艇.

sentences.en: Whether Margaret Thatcher goes down in history as a great leader remains to be seen.
sentences.cn: 玛格丽特·撒切尔能否作为一名伟大的领袖而被载入史册,还有待证实.

words.tran_cn: 茅草，杂草；浓密的头发；茅草屋顶

phrases.tran_cn: 玛格丽特·撒切尔（英国保守党派人士）

trans.tran_en: someone whose job is making roofs from dried  straw  ,  reeds  , leaves etc
